intro: Mananthes suratensis, commonly known as Surat's mannan, is a rare flowering plant native to the western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
